EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  9.01
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
					 
FROM:
Chris D. Funk, Superintendent
					 
					 
PREPARED BY:
Cari Vaeth, Director, Human Resources
					 
SUBJECT:
Hold Public Hearing at Approximately 6:00 p.m. Regarding the Proposed Adoption of the Initial Proposal for the Successor Contract: From East Side Union High School District to East Side Teachers Association
	 
	 
The East Side Union High School District presents the following initial proposal to the East Side Teachers Association for the 2014-2015 school year.  Pursuant to Government Code §3547 the District’s initial proposal must be presented to the public in open session at a public meeting.
	 
The District continues to acknowledge and appreciate the contributions made to its mission and programs 
by its certificated employees, and continues to seek the utilization of equitable and collaborative methods 
of addressing the needs of the students, parents and employees of the East Side Union High School District.  Accordingly, the District initially proposes to continue the language of the present agreement for the 
2014-2015 school year except as modified in a manner consistent with the matters and issues described below.
	 
The District proposes the following areas for negotiations: total compensation which includes salary and benefits; contract language amendments to Articles 11, 14, 15, 18, 30, 31, Appendix M. The District also has an interest in ensuring that contract language is consistent with current funding formulas; eliminating references to COLA. The District seeks a three year agreement.
	 
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Various
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
To be negotiated
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
Administration recommends that the Board sunshine and accept any comment on the District’s initial proposal to the East Side Teachers Association.

EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
		 
Item: 13.01
TO:
Board of Trustees
					 
					 
FROM:  
Chris D. Funk, Superintendent
					 
					 
PREPARED BY:
Marcus Battle, Associate Superintendent of Business Services, and Karen Poon, Director of Finance
					 
					 
SUBJECT:
Discussion and/or Action to Receive and Approve the Second Interim Financial Report for Fiscal Year 2013/14
		 
		 
This is the second of two (2) Interim Reports to be presented to the Governing Board for the 2013-14 fiscal year.  The report provides the Board with the financial status of the District as of January 31, 2014.  This Report is presented to the Board to provide the current fiscal status of the District and to meet the fiscal accountability requirements of AB 1200.  
		 
Included is an executive summary which summarizes the financial data from the SACS Reporting System and budget assumptions that provide the basis for determining the District’s fiscal status.  In addition, there are supporting documentation and comparative analysis of the 2013/14 First Interim vs. Second Interim updates as of January 31, 2014, multi-year projections, State reporting forms, and other related documents.  These documents and worksheets serve as tools to certify the ongoing fiscal health of the District for this current year, as well as the two (2) subsequent fiscal years.  
		 
California school district revenues and expenditures are subject to constant change.  School district budgets are not static documents but, instead, are constantly revised to respond to decisions and actions at the State, local, and Federal levels.  The Second Interim financial projections have been updated to reflect new information received and Board actions taken since the Budget was adopted.  
		 
California Education Code Section 42131 requires that the Governing Board of each school district certify in writing within 45 days after the close of the period being reported whether or not the school district is able to meet its financial obligations for the remainder of the fiscal year and subsequent two fiscal years.  The certification is classified as either positive, qualified, or negative.   
		 
Based on the District's Second Interim Report and multi-year projections as of January 31, 2014, I am recommending that the Board approve the attached positive certification for the East Side Union High School District.  Your approval will provide certification to the State ensuring that the District is able to meet its financial obligations for the current fiscal year and subsequent two (2) fiscal years.
 
FISCAL IMPACT:
Not Applicable
		 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Not Applicable
		 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees receive and approve the Second Interim Financial Report revisions to the operating budget as presented for fiscal year 2013/14.

Item:  14.01
	 
	 
	 
TO:

FROM:

SUBJECT:
Review, Consideration and Adoption of Resolution #2013/2014-18 
Authorizing Reduction in Certificated Workforce
	 
	 
	 
RESOLUTION OF
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
REDUCTION OF A PARTICULAR KIND OF SERVICE
	 
RESOLUTION # 2013/2014-18
	 
	 
	 
WHEREAS, the Superintendent of the East Side Union High School District (“District”), has recommended to the District’s Governing Board (“Board”) that the District reduce particular kinds of service no later than the beginning of the 2014-2015 school year; 
	 
WHEREAS, the recommendation includes the assessment that it shall be necessary to reduce the following particular kinds of service of the District no later than the beginning of the 2014-2015 school year:
	 
	 
	 
Kind of Service 
Number of Full-Time Equivalent Positions (“FTEs”)
Subject Area Coordinator – Counseling

WHEREAS, the Governing Board is required by law to give notice, prior to March 15, 2014, to all certificated employees affected by any decision to reduce or eliminate this particular kind of service;
	 
IT IS RESOLVED THAT:
	 
The Board hereby determines to reduce services as specified in the recommendation set forth in the recitals above, no later than the beginning of the 2014-2015 school year.
	 
The Board hereby determines that, as the result of the above-stated reduction of particular kinds of service (the “Reduction in Force”), it will be necessary to terminate at the end of the 2013-2014 school year the employment of certificated employees of the District in a quantity and kind equal to the FTEs specified in the recommendation set forth in the recitals above.
	 
In order to implement this Reduction in Force, it may be necessary to apply tie-breaking criteria to distinguish among certificated employees who first rendered paid probationary service to the District on the same date.  Pursuant to Education Code section 44955(b), the Board determines that the order of layoff as between employees who first rendered paid service to the District on the same date shall be established on the basis of the criteria set forth in Exhibit A to this Resolution, which are incorporated as though fully set forth herein.
	 
The criteria set forth in Exhibit A to this Resolution shall also be used to determine the order of reemployment among those certificated employees who first rendered paid probationary service to the District on the same date.  The Superintendent, or his designee, has the discretion to determine the appropriate weight of such criteria and the order in which such criteria are most relevant to serve the needs of the District and students in each tie-breaking situation.
	 
	 
The Superintendent is directed to send appropriate notices to all employees affected by the above-described reduction of a particular kind of service in accordance with the provisions of the California Education Code, to take all necessary action to implement this Resolution, and to afford the employees all rights to which they are entitled under the law and applicable Collective Bargaining Agreement(s).    
	 
	 
	 
PASSED AND ADOPTED this 6th day of March, 2014.
	 
	 
                                                            BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF THE 
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
	 
	 
                                                            By:                                                                   
                                                                   J. Manuel Herrera
                                                                   President of the Board of Trustees of
                                                                   The East Side Union High School District
	 
	 
	 
                                                            By:                                                                   
                                                                   Magdalena Carrasco
                                                                   Clerk of the Board of Trustees of
                                                                   The East Side Union High School District
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
Exhibit A
	 
TIEBREAKING CRITERIA PURSUANT TO EDUCATION CODE SECTION 44955(b)
	 
Employees sharing the same first date of paid probationary service to the District shall be awarded tiebreaking points on the following basis:
	 
	 
Criterion
Points
Possession of credential(s) authorizing service for the District
4 for each professional clear credential
					 
3 for each preliminary credential
					 
2 for intern credential
					 
1 for provisional internship permit or short-term staff permit
					 
					 
Possession of Cross-Cultural Language and Development certificate or its equivalent
					 
1
					 
					 
Possession of Bilingual Cross-Cultural Language
and Development certificate or its equivalent
					 
1
	 
Employees with a greater number of points shall be considered more senior than employees with a fewer number of points, for purposes of determining order of layoff and order of reemployment.
	 
If application of the foregoing criteria fails to resolve a tie among two or more employees, among the employees who remain tied the employee with the earliest date of issuance of a preliminary or professional clear credential shall be considered the more senior employee.  As among employees who remain tied who have never obtained a preliminary or professional clear credential, the employee with the earliest date of issuance of an intern credential shall be considered the more senior employee.  As among employees who remain tied who have never obtained an intern, preliminary, or professional clear credential, the employee with the earliest date of issuance of an emergency or pre-intern credential, provisional intern permit or short-term staff permit shall be considered the more senior employee.
	 
The Superintendent is authorized to determine the number of tiebreaking points to be awarded to each employee and to determine the manner in which the tiebreaking criteria shall be applied to each employee.
